Feature Extraction.description: Extracts the underlying features from the text.
Feature Extraction.usage: Used in text analysis, to understand underlying patterns.
Feature Extraction.expected_output: A vector representation of the text.

Fill-Mask.description: Predicts the missing word in a sentence.
Fill-Mask.usage: Can be used for data augmentation or to guess missing words.

NER.description: Identifies entities in the text like names, locations, dates.
NER.usage: Used in information extraction to identify and classify named entities.
NER.sample_input: Albert Einstein was born in Ulm.

Question Answering.description: Answers questions based on the context provided.
Question Answering.usage: Useful for building automated FAQ or information retrieval systems.
Question Answering.sample_input: Context: Python is a programming language. Question: What is Python?

Sentiment Analysis.description: Determines if the sentiment is positive, negative, or neutral.
Sentiment Analysis.usage: Commonly used in analyzing customer feedback, social media.

Summarization.description: Provides a summary of the input text.
Summarization.usage: Helpful for condensing large texts into shorter summaries.
Summarization.sample_input: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.
Summarization.expected_output: A concise summary of the text.

Text Generation.description: Generates text based on the input.
Text Generation.usage: Can be used for content creation, chatbots, and more.

Translation (EN to FR).usage: Useful for translating content between languages.

Zero-Shot Classification.description: Classifies text without needing explicit examples for training.
Zero-Shot Classification.usage: Useful for classifying text into predefined categories.
Zero-Shot Classification.sample_input: This is a course about AI.
